required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Systane速 Balance in Dry Eye Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Systane速 Balance on Corneal Staining in Indian Subjects With Dry Eye

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Systane速 Balance following 90 days of QID (4 times/day) dosing among Indian subjects with dry eye.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was conducted in India.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Corneal Staining Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The type (severity) of staining was assessed for each of the 5 regions of the cornea (central, inferior, temporal, superior, and nasal) and graded on a 4-point scale, where 0 = Normal (No staining) and 3 = Severe (Numerous coalescent macropunctate areas and/or patches). The scores of the 5 regions were summed to obtain a corneal staining total score for each eye (minimum 0, maximum 15).

arm_group.description: Propylene Glycol 0.6% eye drops, 1 drop QID (with the last dose of each day at bedtime) in each eye for 90 days

link.description: Results from the Novartis Clinical Trial Results Website

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled from 4 study sites located in India.

group.title: Systane Balance
group.description: Propylene Glycol 0.6% eye drops, 1 drop QID (4 times/day) (with the last dose of each day at bedtime) in each eye for 90 days

group.title: Systane Balance
group.description: Propylene Glycol 0.6% eye drops, 1 drop QID (with the last dose of each day at bedtime) in each eye for 90 days

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Corneal Staining Total Score
outcome.description: The type (severity) of staining was assessed for each of the 5 regions of the cornea (central, inferior, temporal, superior, and nasal) and graded on a 4-point scale, where 0 = Normal (No staining) and 3 = Severe (Numerous coalescent macropunctate areas and/or patches). The scores of the 5 regions were summed to obtain a corneal staining total score for each eye (minimum 0, maximum 15).
outcome.population: Analysis includes all participants with data present. Analysis was based on the eye with the higher corneal staining total score at screening or the right eye when both eyes have same corneal staining total score at screening, as observed.

group.title: Systane Balance
group.description: Propylene Glycol 0.6% eye drops, 1 drop QID (with the last dose of each day at bedtime) in each eye for 90 days

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Corneal Staining Total Score
measure.description: The type (severity) of staining was assessed for each of the 5 regions of the cornea (central, inferior, temporal, superior, and nasal) and graded on a 4-point scale, where 0 = Normal (No staining) and 3 = Severe (Numerous coalescent macropunctate areas and/or patches). The scores of the 5 regions were summed to obtain a corneal staining total score for each eye (minimum 0, maximum 15).
measure.population: Analysis includes all participants with data present. Analysis was based on the eye with the higher corneal staining total score at screening or the right eye when both eyes have same corneal staining total score at screening, as observed.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of participation, an average of 90 days.

group.title: Systane Balance
group.description: Propylene Glycol 0.6% eye drops, 1 drop QID (with the last dose of each day at bedtime) in each eye for 90 days

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
